skill.name: recovery
skill.description: Recover session state from memory-keeper after context loss.
skill.summary: Recover session state from memory-keeper after context loss.
skill.author: Barnhardt-Enterprises-Inc

security_audit.summary: All 31 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. SKILL.md contains only documentation for memory-keeper MCP tools using markdown code fences. The 'backticks' flagged are markdown delimiters, not shell execution. Function names like 'context_get' contain 'get' which triggered false 'cryptographic' flags. No code execution, network calls, filesystem access, or external commands exist. The skill-report.json already contains an accurate security audit confirming 'safe' status.

content.value_statement: Context loss disrupts workflow and wastes time recreating progress. This skill retrieves saved checkpoints and progress items from memory-keeper to restore session state instantly.
actual_capabilities: Retrieves recent context items from memory-keeper database
Identifies files modified in previous sessions
Locates next action items and blockers
Presents recovered state in human-readable format
limitations: Requires memory-keeper MCP server to be configured
Cannot recover context from sessions that did not checkpoint
Cannot restore if memory was explicitly cleared
Only works with context items stored by memory-keeper

use_cases.title: Resume interrupted work
use_cases.description: Continue coding sessions after context exhaustion without losing progress or manually tracking state.

use_cases.title: Restore from checkpoints
use_cases.description: Get quick summary of where work left off when reconnecting to an agent session.

use_cases.title: Track team progress
use_cases.description: Understand current task status and next steps when reviewing developer session history.

prompt_templates.title: Basic recovery
prompt_templates.prompt: Recover my session context. What was I working on?

prompt_templates.title: After context loss
prompt_templates.prompt: Restore from my last checkpoint. Show me what files I modified and what I need to do next.

prompt_templates.title: Progress check
prompt_templates.prompt: Give me a summary of my current task progress and next action.

prompt_templates.title: Recovery verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify my recovered context and confirm the next step before I proceed.

output_examples.input: Recover my session context. What was I working on?
output: Previous Task: Implementing user authentication feature
Progress: 75% complete - backend done, frontend in progress
Next Action: Complete form validation in login.tsx component

output_examples.input: Restore from my last checkpoint. Show me what files I modified.
output: Progress: 60% complete - schema defined, data migration pending
Blockers: Need production downtime window approval
Next Action: Review migration script for edge cases

best_practices: Checkpoint frequently during complex tasks using memory-keeper
Review recovered context before continuing work
Use consistent naming conventions for checkpoints
anti_patterns: Working without checkpointing before long operations
Assuming all session data is automatically saved

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all Claude products?
faq.answer: Yes, works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code when memory-keeper MCP is configured.

faq.question: What data does this skill access?
faq.answer: Only context items stored in memory-keeper. No files, environment variables, or network calls.

faq.question: Can I recover context from yesterday?
faq.answer: Yes, if memory-keeper MCP was running and checkpointing during your session.

faq.question: What happens if no context is found?
faq.answer: The skill presents a clear message explaining why no context exists and offers next steps.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my workflow?
faq.answer: Use memory-keeper checkpoint functions regularly. Run recovery at the start of new sessions.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a read-only skill that only retrieves your own stored context data.
